private_information: I focus on disks A, B, and C (the three smallest disks).
Disk A is smallest, followed by B, then C.
planner_a.goal: Generate a PDDL plan segment addressing the movement of disks A, B, and C to achieve the global goal.

private_information: I focus on disks D, E, and F (the three largest disks).
Disk D is smallest of my set, followed by E, then F (which is the largest disk overall).
planner_b.goal: Generate a PDDL plan segment addressing the movement of disks D, E, and F to achieve the global goal.

private_information: Hanoi Rule 3: A larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.
All disks must maintain their relative size ordering: A<B<C<D<E<F.
auditor.goal: Audit the PDDL segments provided by the planners for consistency with the strict rules of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle, ensuring no size constraint violations.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the fragmented PDDL plans from planner_a and planner_b, incorporating feedback from the auditor, to create a final, comprehensive PDDL solution for the 6-disk Tower of Hanoi puzzle, moving all disks from the Right peg to the Middle peg.

init.initial_state: Right Peg holds A (top) through F (bottom). Left and Middle pegs are empty.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle involving 6 unique disks (A, B, C, D, E, F) and 3 pegs (Left, Middle, Right).
Rules: Move one top disk at a time; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
Goal: Move all 6 disks from the Right peg to the Middle peg, using the Left peg as auxiliary storage.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve a specialized segment of the task. Focus only on the objects listed in your private knowledge.

You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve a specialized segment of the task. Focus only on the objects listed in your private knowledge.

audit.system_prompt: You are a specialized auditor focusing on temporal and causal consistency in planning domains, specifically enforcing the strict rules of the Tower of Hanoi puzzle. Your goal is to identify and report any bookkeeping shortcuts that lead to non-adherence to the rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You must integrate possibly fragmented plans and external constraints (audit report) into a single, comprehensive PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards planner.
